glosses: Out of fear for one's life, for dear life, desperately.

etymology: Inherited from Ottoman Turkish جان هولیله (can havliyle), from جان (cān, can) and هول (havl, havil), equivalent to can (“life, soul, heart”) + havl (“fright, terror”) + -i (possessive suffix) + -yle, literally “with terror for (one's) life/soul”, or can + havli + ile.
